name: Sodium Benzoate
description: Preservative. High metabolic risk in some studies.

name: Sucralose
description: Artificial sweetener. Potentially disrupts gut microbiome.

name: Maltitol
description: Sugar alcohol. High glycemic index for a polyol; can cause laxative effect.

name: Disodium 5'-Guanylate
description: Flavor enhancer often used with MSG. Should be avoided by people with gout or kidney stones as it metabolizes into purines.

name: Disodium 5'-Inosinate
description: A flavor enhancer that works synergistically with glutamates. Like INS 627, it is high in purines and generally avoided by those with uric acid concerns.

name: Gum Arabic (Acacia Gum)
description: A natural prebiotic fiber derived from the sap of the Acacia tree. Highly safe and beneficial for gut health.

name: Potassium Chloride
description: Used as a salt substitute or gelling agent. Generally safe, though a minor penalty is applied as high intake can be an issue for individuals with specific kidney conditions.

name: Silicon Dioxide
description: An anti-caking agent used to prevent clumping. While inert, there are emerging concerns regarding nano-particle absorption in the digestive tract.

name: Soy Lecithin
description: Common emulsifier. Generally safe but highly processed.

name: Xanthan Gum
description: Stabilizer produced by fermentation. Low risk.

name: Citric Acid
description: Natural acidity regulator. Minimal risk.

name: Pectin
description: Natural fiber from fruits. Safe.

name: Sodium Bicarbonate
description: Sodium bicarbonate. Standard leavening agent.

name: Glycerol (Glycerine)
description: A natural polyol used as a humectant to keep protein bars moist. Generally safe and non-toxic, though can have a mild laxative effect in very high quantities.

name: Chlorophylls
description: Natural green pigment extracted from plants (spinach or grass). Highly safe and biocompatible.

name: Sulphite Ammonia Caramel
description: A dark coloring agent produced by heating carbohydrates with ammonium and sulfite compounds. Contains 4-MEI, a potential carcinogen in high doses.

name: Tocopherol Concentrate, Mixed
description: Natural Vitamin E extract used to prevent oxidation of fats. Considered a beneficial health compound.

name: Butylated Hydroxyanisole (BHA)
description: A synthetic antioxidant used to prevent rancidity. Classified as a 'reasonably anticipated human carcinogen' and linked to endocrine disruption.

name: Guar Gum
description: Natural thickener from guar beans. Safe and acts as a prebiotic.

name: Acesulfame Potassium
description: Artificial sweetener. Often paired with Sucralose. Some concerns over metabolic health.

name: Steviol Glycosides
description: Natural zero-calorie sweetener from Stevia leaves. Highly safe.

name: Carrageenan
description: Thickener derived from seaweed. Linked to digestive inflammation in some individuals.

name: Mono- and Diglycerides of Fatty Acids
description: Common emulsifier used to improve texture. Generally safe but markers of high processing.

name: Potassium Sorbate
description: Preservative. Prevents mold. Lower risk than Benzoates but still synthetic.

name: Mannitol
description: Sugar alcohol. Can cause bloating and has a laxative effect.

name: Calcium Propionate
description: Common bread preservative. Generally safe but associated with behavioral changes in sensitive children.

name: Sorbic Acid
description: Preservative used to prevent mold. Low toxicity but synthetic.

name: Monocalcium Phosphate
description: Leavening agent and acidulant. Standard mineral salt.

name: Acetic Acid
description: Glacial acetic acid (vinegar acid). Safe acidity regulator.

name: Fumaric Acid
description: Acidity regulator found naturally in some plants.

name: Ammonium Chloride
description: Flour treatment agent (yeast food). Highly processed chemical salt.

name: Amylases
description: Enzymes used to break down starch into sugars for yeast. Natural biological catalyst.
